options.name: Elasticsearch URL
options.description: URL for your Elasticsearch REST API including the schema and port if applicable (e.g., https://elastic.prod:9200)

options.name: Kibana URL
options.description: URL for your Elasticsearch Kibana interface including the schema and port if applicable (e.g., https://elastic.prod:9243/app/kibana).  If left blank no link to Kibana will be shown.

options.name: Username
options.description: Elasticsearch account username (Leave this blank if you are not using Basic Auth via Shield)

options.name: Password
options.description: Elasticsearch account password (Leave this blank if you are not using Basic Auth via Shield)

options.name: API Key
options.description: Elasticsearch API Key in Base64 format. Leave this blank if you are using Basic Auth via X-Pack (i.e., if you have a username and password) or have no authentication setup.

options.name: Index for Elasticsearch
options.description: Comma delimited list of Elasticsearch indexes you want searched for results (no spaces between commas)

options.name: Search Query
options.description: The search query to execute as JSON.  The top level property should be a `query` object and must be a valid JSON search request when sent to the ES `_search` REST endpoint.

options.name: Enable Highlighting
options.description: If checked, the integration will display highlighted search terms via the Elasticsearch Highlighter.

options.name: Highlight Query
options.description: The highlighter query to execute when a user clicks to view additional details. The top level property should be a `query` object. This query should typically match the query portion of your `Search Query`.  Highlighting will attempt to highlight against all fields and will return the first 10 results.  Only runs if the `Enable Highlighting` option is checked

options.name: Summary Fields
options.description: Comma delimited list of field names to include as part of the summary tags.  JSON dot notation can be used to target nested attributes including fields inside the `_source` attribute. Fields must be returned by your search query to be displayed.  You can change the label for your fields by prepending the label to the field path and separating it with a colon (i.e., "<label>:<json path>").  If left blank, a result count will be shown. This option should be set to "Only Admins can View and Edit".

options.name: Details Fields
options.description: Comma delimited list of field names to include as part of the details block.  JSON dot notation can be used to target nested attributes including fields inside the `_source` attribute. Fields must be returned by your search query to be displayed.  You can change the label for your fields by prepending the label to the field path and separating it with a colon (i.e., "<label>:<json path>").  If left blank, all fields will be shown. This option should be set to "Only Admins can View and Edit".

options.name: Document Title Field
options.description: "_source" field to use as the title for each returned document in the details template.  This field must be returned by your search query.

options.name: Max Concurrent Search Requests
options.description: Maximum number of concurrent search requests (defaults to 10).  Integration must be restarted after changing this option.

options.name: Minimum Time Between Searches
options.description: Minimum amount of time in milliseconds between each entity search (defaults to 50).  Integration must be restarted after changing this option.

options.name: Search Private IPs
options.description: If checked, the integration will search private IPs.
